publications.title: Social Network Influences on Young Adult Smoking Behaviors
publications.summary: This study examined how peer networks influence smoking initiation and cessation among young adults aged 18-25. Using social network analysis and longitudinal survey data, we found that having a higher proportion of smokers in one's social circle significantly increased the likelihood of smoking initiation and decreased the chances of successful cessation attempts.
publications.snippet: Results indicated a strong correlation between network composition and individual smoking behaviors (r = 0.63, p < 0.001). Participants with over 30% smokers in their immediate social network were 2.4 times more likely to initiate smoking within the 2-year study period compared to those with less than 10% smokers in their network.

research.title: Exploring Efficient AI Models for Resource-Constrained Devices
research.description: Investigating techniques to optimize AI models for deployment on mobile and IoT devices with limited computational resources.
research.summary: This research focuses on developing and implementing efficient AI algorithms that can run effectively on devices with constrained computational capabilities, such as smartphones and IoT sensors. The study explores various optimization techniques, including model compression, quantization, and neural architecture search, to create high-performance, low-footprint AI models suitable for edge computing applications.
research.snippet: Our preliminary results demonstrate that through careful model design and optimization, we can achieve up to 80% reduction in model size while maintaining 95% of the original accuracy. This significant improvement in efficiency opens up new possibilities for AI-powered applications on resource-limited devices, potentially revolutionizing fields such as mobile health monitoring, smart home systems, and autonomous IoT networks.

By making these models more interpretable, we aim to increase trust and adoption among healthcare professionals, ultimately improving patient care and outcomes.
research.snippet: Our approach combines attention mechanisms with layer-wise relevance propagation to highlight the regions of medical images that most significantly influence the AI's decision-making process. Preliminary results show a 15% improvement in radiologists' confidence when interpreting AI-assisted diagnoses.

publications.title: Towards Trustworthy AI: A Novel Approach for Explainable Medical Image Analysis
publications.authors: Ott, C., Johnson, E., et al.
publications.journal: Journal of Artificial Intelligence in Medicine
publications.summary: This paper presents a new methodology for making AI-based medical image analysis more transparent and interpretable. The proposed approach combines advanced visualization techniques with natural language explanations to help healthcare professionals understand and trust AI-generated diagnoses.
publications.snippet: We introduce a hybrid explainability framework that integrates visual saliency maps with textual justifications. Our experiments on a diverse set of medical imaging tasks demonstrate that this approach significantly improves clinicians' ability to interpret and validate AI-assisted diagnoses, potentially leading to more accurate and timely patient care.

research.title: Noninvasive ultrasonic drug uncaging maps whole-brain functional networks
research.authors: JB Wang, M Aryal, Q Zhong, DB Vyas, RD Airan
research.summary: This research introduces a novel method for noninvasive, targeted drug delivery in the brain using ultrasound-sensitive nanoparticles. The technique allows for precise mapping of brain networks by selectively activating specific regions.
research.snippet: We developed a platform technology for noninvasive pharmacological neuromodulation with anatomical and temporal precision. The approach uses focused ultrasound (FUS) to transiently disrupt the blood-brain barrier (BBB) and allow the passive accumulation of systemically administered drug-loaded nanoparticles. Subsequent FUS application triggers nanoparticle cavitation, releasing their payload locally to activate specific brain circuits.

research.title: Focused ultrasound for noninvasive, focal pharmacologic neurointervention
research.authors: JB Wang, T Di Ianni, DB Vyas, Z Huang, S Park, N Hosseini-Nassab, ...
research.summary: This paper reviews the use of focused ultrasound for targeted drug delivery in the brain. It discusses various approaches, including blood-brain barrier disruption and ultrasound-sensitive nanocarriers, highlighting their potential for treating neurological disorders.
research.snippet: Focused ultrasound (FUS) has emerged as a promising tool for noninvasive, targeted drug delivery to the brain. This review discusses two main approaches: (1) FUS-mediated blood-brain barrier disruption to enhance the penetration of systemically administered drugs, and (2) FUS-triggered release from circulating drug carriers. We explore the mechanisms, current preclinical and clinical applications, and future directions of these techniques.

research.title: Safety and Efficacy of Percutaneous Drain Placement for Postsurgical Breast Region Fluid Collections
research.summary: This study investigates the safety and effectiveness of using percutaneous drains to manage fluid collections that occur after breast surgery. The research aims to provide evidence for a minimally invasive approach to treating post-operative complications in breast procedures.
research.snippet: Percutaneous drain placement has emerged as a promising technique for managing postsurgical fluid collections in the breast region. This study evaluates the outcomes of this procedure, focusing on its safety profile and efficacy in resolving fluid accumulations. The results suggest that percutaneous drainage may offer a less invasive alternative to surgical intervention for select patients.

research.title: Viscoelastic measurements of abscess fluids using a magnetic stress rheometer
research.summary: This research explores the viscoelastic properties of abscess fluids using advanced rheological techniques. By employing a magnetic stress rheometer, the study aims to characterize the complex mechanical behavior of these biological fluids, which could have implications for diagnostic and therapeutic approaches in managing abscesses.
research.snippet: Abscesses present unique challenges in medical treatment due to their complex fluid compositions. This study utilizes a magnetic stress rheometer to conduct detailed viscoelastic measurements of abscess fluids. The findings reveal important insights into the mechanical properties of these fluids, potentially informing new strategies for abscess drainage and treatment optimization.

research.title: Label-free monitoring of embolotherapy via catheter electrochemical impedance spectroscopy
research.summary: This innovative study introduces a novel method for monitoring embolization procedures using catheter-based electrochemical impedance spectroscopy. The technique offers a label-free approach to assess embolization endpoints, potentially reducing the need for x-ray fluoroscopy and improving procedural safety and efficacy.
research.snippet: Embolotherapy is a critical interventional procedure, but current monitoring methods rely heavily on x-ray fluoroscopy, exposing patients and physicians to ionizing radiation. This research presents a groundbreaking approach using catheter electrochemical impedance spectroscopy to monitor embolization in real-time. The study demonstrates the ability to detect various embolization endpoints, including stasis and reflux, without the need for contrast agents or radiation exposure.

publications.title: Development and Psychometric Validation of the Olfactory Dysfunction Outcomes Rating
publications.summary: This study developed and validated the Olfactory Dysfunction Outcomes Rating (ODOR), a 28-item instrument to assess olfactory dysfunction. The ODOR demonstrated good psychometric properties and can be used to evaluate the impact of olfactory disorders on patients' quality of life.
publications.snippet: The ODOR is a 28-item instrument with each item scored as either no difficulty or very rarely bothered (0) to complete difficulty or very frequently bothered (4) with a total instrument score range of 0 to 112 points. Higher scores indicate higher degree of dysfunction and limitation. Validation in the cohort of 283 patients (mean [SD] age, 47.0 [14.4] years; 198 female participants [73%]; 179 White participants [80%])...

publications.title: How to Explain and Justify Almost Any Decision: Potential Pitfalls for Accountability in AI Decision-Making
publications.authors: Joyce Zhou, Thorsten Joachims
publications.venue: Proceedings of the 2023 ACM Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency
publications.summary: This paper examines the potential pitfalls of using AI-generated explanations for decision-making accountability. The authors demonstrate that large language models can generate plausible-sounding justifications for arbitrary decisions, raising concerns about the effectiveness of explanation-based accountability measures.
publications.snippet: We show that large language models can generate explanations that appear reasonable and persuasive for almost any decision, even when the decision is arbitrary or contradicts available evidence. This capability raises fundamental questions about the role of explanations in ensuring accountability of AI systems and human decision makers alike.

publications.title: GPT as a Baseline for Recommendation Explanation Texts
publications.authors: Joyce Zhou, Thorsten Joachims
publications.summary: This paper proposes using GPT models as a baseline for generating recommendation explanation texts. The authors evaluate the quality of GPT-generated explanations compared to traditional recommendation systems and human-written explanations.
publications.snippet: We introduce a novel approach to recommendation explanation by leveraging large language models like GPT. Our experiments show that GPT-generated explanations often match or exceed the quality of explanations from specialized recommendation systems, providing a strong baseline for future research in this area.

projects.name: Language-Based User Profiles for Recommendation

projects.summary: This project explores the use of language models to create rich user profiles for personalized recommendations. publications.summary: This paper explores the use of ensemble machine learning techniques for the early detection of coronary heart disease. The study compares various algorithms including kNN, Logistic Classification, and Naive Bayes with ensemble methods such as bagging, boosting, and stacking.

The method was validated on real-world SCADA datasets from power distribution networks.

research.description: A documentary film project critically examining the societal implications of AI, focusing on regulatory uses and promoting non-technical engagements in AI. The project aims to shift perspectives on AI as a neutral tool and explores its expansion into the public realm.
research.summary: This project involves the production of a documentary film that investigates the ethical considerations surrounding artificial intelligence, particularly its regulatory applications. The film aims to challenge the notion of technology as a neutral tool and examines AI's gradual integration into public spaces. It emphasizes the importance of considering power dynamics, cultural factors, and ethical priorities in AI development.
research.snippet: The documentary 'Opening the Loop' seeks to critically interrogate how broader issues regarding power, culture and our ethical priorities influence current developments of artificial intelligence. Primarily focusing on AI's regulatory uses, it aims to shift away from predominant attitudes that technology is merely a neutral tool and focuses on AI's slow expansion into the public realm.

publications.summary: This paper explores the dual nature of deepfake technology, focusing on its effects on Generation Z's mental health and social interactions. publications.snippet: Deepfake technology presents a complex challenge for Generation Z, offering both creative opportunities and potential threats to personal privacy and information integrity. research.title: Exploring Author Profiling for Fake News Detection
research.summary: This research focuses on designing author profiles to detect authors primarily engaged in publishing fake news articles. The study explores the potential to detect fake news authors by analyzing writing style, sentiment, and co-authorship patterns. The research evaluates different supervised machine learning models using a dataset of over 5000 authors and 20000 articles.
research.snippet: We build on the hypothesis that authors who write fake news repeatedly write only fake news articles, at least in short-term periods. Fake news authors have a distinct writing style compared to real news authors, who naturally want to maintain trustworthiness. We explore the potential to detect fake news authors by designing authors' profiles based on writing style, sentiment, and co-authorship patterns.

publications.snippet: Fairness-aware machine learning has emerged as a critical area of research in recent years, driven by growing concerns about the potential for AI systems to perpetuate or exacerbate societal biases. In this survey, we systematically review the state-of-the-art in fairness-aware ML, covering both theoretical advancements and practical applications. We begin by examining various definitions of fairness in the context of machine learning, including group fairness, individual fairness, and causality-based notions of fairness.

publications.snippet: We propose Generalizable Neural Fields (GNF), a framework that treats neural fields as partially observed neural processes. By leveraging this formulation, GNF demonstrates superior generalization capabilities across diverse 3D scenes and objects, outperforming existing methods in tasks such as novel view synthesis and 3D reconstruction.

research.title: H. pylori colonization in the stomach
research.summary: Dr. Huang's research focused on understanding how the pathogen Helicobacter pylori survives in the harsh environment of the stomach. She studied the mechanisms by which H. pylori detects and navigates towards the epithelial cells, which provide a more favorable environment for colonization.
research.details: Dr. Huang discovered TlpB, a chemoreceptor in H. pylori that enables the bacteria to detect suitable environments and 'swim' toward their home, the epithelial cells. She showed that TlpB detects the presence of urea, allowing H. pylori to find a more neutral environment where it can survive. This demonstrates that bacteria not only can sense potentially harmful cues, like low pH, but can also react to favorable factors, like urea, when finding their new home.

publications.title: H. pylori finds its home
publications.summary: This publication discusses how H. pylori, a bacterium associated with stomach ulcers and cancer, colonizes the human stomach despite its harsh acidic environment. The research reveals the mechanisms by which H. pylori detects and moves towards more favorable conditions within the stomach.
publications.snippet: We discovered that H. pylori uses a chemoreceptor called TlpB to detect urea, which allows the bacteria to locate areas with a more neutral pH. This finding provides new insights into how H. pylori establishes itself in the stomach and opens up potential avenues for developing novel treatments for H. pylori-related diseases.

research.title: Efficient unitary designs and pseudorandom unitaries from random sums
research.description: This research explores advancements in quantum computing, specifically focusing on generating efficient unitary designs and pseudorandom unitaries. The study aims to improve quantum algorithms and quantum information processing by developing more efficient methods for creating randomized quantum operations.
research.summary: The research investigates novel techniques for creating unitary designs and pseudorandom unitaries in quantum computing. These mathematical constructs are crucial for various quantum algorithms and protocols. By developing more efficient methods to generate these quantum operations, the study contributes to advancing quantum computing capabilities and potentially improving the performance of quantum algorithms.
research.snippet: Haar randomness is a valuable resource in quantum information, but implementing it exactly is inefficient. We show that random sums of unitaries provide an efficient alternative, yielding both unitary designs and pseudorandom unitaries. Our constructions are based on sums of random Pauli operators, which can be efficiently implemented on a quantum computer.

publications.title: Efficient unitary designs and pseudorandom unitaries from random sums

publications.title: Enforcing Foreign Judgments in the New Global Rivalry
publications.summary: This article examines the transformation of transnational litigation due to the rise of China and Chinese civil procedure, focusing on the recognition and enforcement of foreign judgments. It presents a systematic binational study of judgment enforcement practice within the U.S.-China dyad, revealing trends of both cooperation and conflict.
publications.snippet: The article identifies two types of judgment enforcement requests: 'singular' and 'parallel'. Singular requests, primarily litigated in state courts, show growing cooperation. Parallel requests, often litigated in federal courts, demonstrate increasing conflict. These patterns reflect the complex economic relationship between the U.S. and China, characterized by both dependency and competition.

research.focus: Bordetella pertussis colonization and immune evasion tactics
research.summary: Rachel Fernandez's research focuses on understanding how Bordetella pertussis, the bacterium causing whooping cough, colonizes hosts and evades immune responses. Her work investigates the bacterium's ability to resist complement pathways and modify its lipopolysaccharide structure, which are associated with immune modulation.

Fernandez studies a family of bacterial surface proteins called autotransporters, which are important virulence factors in Gram-negative bacteria. Her research aims to elucidate the mechanisms by which these proteins are secreted by bacteria.

publications.title: Intrinsically stretchable biphasic (solid–liquid) thin metal films
publications.summary: This paper presents a novel approach to creating intrinsically stretchable metal films by combining solid and liquid metal phases. The researchers developed a method to fabricate thin metal films that can maintain electrical conductivity while being stretched to over 700% of their original length.
publications.snippet: Stretchable conductors are essential components for stretchable electronics and soft machines. We report an approach to intrinsically stretchable metal films by combining solid and liquid metal phases. The biphasic (solid-liquid) films are obtained by introducing a liquid metal into the grain boundaries of polycrystalline metal films.

publications.title: Insurance Coverage and Prescription Drug Costs
publications.summary: This study investigated the impact of insurance coverage on prescription drug costs. The research found that insurance may not be helping consumers save as much on prescriptions as commonly believed.
publications.snippet: Our analysis of prescription drug costs across various insurance plans revealed a significant discrepancy between perceived and actual savings. While insurance coverage generally reduces out-of-pocket expenses for patients, the overall cost reduction is often less substantial than expected. This finding highlights the need for greater transparency in pharmaceutical pricing and insurance coverage policies.

publications.title: Attention-based Multi-modal Fusion for Video Understanding
publications.authors: Yixuan Qiao, John Smith, Jane Doe
publications.summary: This paper proposes a novel attention-based multi-modal fusion approach for video understanding. The method integrates visual, audio, and textual information to improve video classification and captioning tasks.
publications.snippet: We introduce a transformer-based architecture that learns to attend to different modalities dynamically. Our experiments on large-scale video datasets demonstrate significant improvements over state-of-the-art unimodal and multimodal baselines.

publications.title: Efficient Few-shot Learning for Natural Language Understanding
publications.authors: Yixuan Qiao, Alice Johnson
publications.summary: This research presents a novel approach to few-shot learning in natural language understanding tasks. The method leverages meta-learning techniques to quickly adapt to new tasks with limited labeled data.
publications.snippet: Our proposed meta-learning algorithm, combined with a task-adaptive pre-training strategy, achieves state-of-the-art performance on multiple NLU benchmarks in few-shot settings. We provide extensive analysis on the model's ability to generalize across different domains and languages.

projects.name: GlMath
projects.description: A math education platform inspired by Khan Academy, built with the MERN stack.
projects.summary: GlMath is a comprehensive math education platform that allows teachers to create and publish math lessons for a global student audience. Built using the MERN (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js) stack, the platform incorporates several innovative design choices to ensure content reliability. Lessons are stored as JSON on GitHub Pages, with an admin interface for content management that automatically commits changes to GitHub. This approach ensures lesson availability even if the backend server experiences downtime. Additional features include image uploading via Amazon S3 and an interactive WYSIWYG LaTeX editor for equation input.

research.snippet: Glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) is the most common and aggressive primary brain tumor in adults, with a median survival of only 12-15 months despite aggressive treatment. The model was trained on a large dataset of GBM patients, incorporating features such as tumor location, size, and genetic markers. Results showed improved accuracy in predicting survival times and treatment responses compared to traditional prognostic methods.

publications.summary: This paper introduces EnhancedTouch, a new haptic feedback system designed to improve tactile sensations in virtual reality environments. He studies atoms cooled to temperatures a million times colder than outer space, where they behave more like waves than particles. His work involves mathematical calculations to explain and understand these quantum systems, which exhibit novel phases of matter and mysterious phenomena.

publications.title: Quantum mechanical behavior of ultracold atoms
publications.summary: This paper explores the unique properties of ultracold atomic systems governed by quantum mechanics rather than classical physics. It delves into the wave-like behavior of atoms at extremely low temperatures and discusses the implications for understanding various quantum phenomena.
publications.snippet: When cooled to temperatures approaching absolute zero, atomic gases enter a regime where quantum effects dominate. This paper presents a theoretical framework for describing the collective behavior of these ultracold atoms, including their coherence properties and quantum phase transitions. We derive analytical expressions for key observables and compare them with numerical simulations and experimental data from leading ultracold atom laboratories.

projects.title: Ultracold Atom Quantum Simulator
projects.summary: Developed a computational model to simulate the behavior of ultracold atoms in various potential landscapes. This project aims to predict and analyze quantum many-body effects in experimentally realizable systems.

awards.title: Second Place Winner
awards.description: Recognized for effectively condensing complex research into a concise three-minute presentation, demonstrating strong communication skills in explaining quantum physics concepts to a general audience.

publications.title: The Trade War: Outlook, Not So Good
publications.summary: This article analyzes the ongoing trade war and its potential outcomes. Wang argues that trade wars, similar to nuclear conflicts, are essentially unwinnable and can have far-reaching negative consequences for all parties involved.
publications.snippet: Trade wars, like their nuclear counterparts, are essentially unwinnable. Once one side pulls the trigger, both sides are likely to suffer significant economic damage. The current trade war between the United States and China has already led to increased tariffs, market volatility, and economic uncertainty for businesses and consumers alike.

publications.title: Severe cutaneous ulcerations secondary to xylazine (tranq): A case series
publications.authors: Wei J.J., Wachuku C, Berk-Krauss J, Steele KT, Rosenbach M, Messenger E
publications.summary: This case series examines severe cutaneous ulcerations caused by xylazine, a veterinary sedative increasingly found in illicit drug supplies. The study highlights the clinical presentation and challenges in managing these wounds, emphasizing the need for awareness among healthcare providers.
publications.snippet: Xylazine, colloquially known as 'tranq,' is a veterinary sedative that has become increasingly prevalent in the illicit drug supply, particularly in combination with opioids. This case series presents patients with severe cutaneous ulcerations secondary to xylazine exposure. The wounds were characterized by deep, necrotic lesions with a distinctive clinical appearance. Management of these ulcerations posed significant challenges due to their depth, chronicity, and the patients' ongoing substance use.

publications.title: Exuberant Contact Dermatitis leading to Hand Compartment Syndrome
publications.authors: Patel, J., Lewis, D., Wei, J.J., Coromilas, A., Micheletti, R.G.
publications.summary: This case report describes an unusual presentation of contact dermatitis that progressed to hand compartment syndrome. The study emphasizes the importance of early recognition and intervention in severe cases of contact dermatitis to prevent complications.
publications.snippet: We present a case of severe contact dermatitis that rapidly progressed to hand compartment syndrome, a rare but potentially devastating complication. The patient, a 45-year-old male, presented with acute onset of hand swelling and pain following exposure to an industrial cleaning agent. Despite initial treatment with topical corticosteroids, the patient's symptoms worsened, leading to decreased range of motion and sensory changes indicative of compartment syndrome.

publications.title: Identification of a Neutrophil-Specific PIK3R1 Mutation Facilitates Targeted Treatment in a Patient with Sweet Syndrome
publications.authors: Bhattacharya, S., Basu, S, Sheng, E., Murphy, C., Wei, J.J., Kersh, A.E., Nelson, C.A., Bryer, J.S., Ashchyan, H.A., Steele, K.T., Forrestel, A.K., Seykora, J.T., Micheletti, R.G., James, W.D., Rosenbach, M., Leung, T.H.
publications.summary: This research identifies a novel neutrophil-specific PIK3R1 mutation in a patient with Sweet syndrome, a rare inflammatory skin condition. The discovery allowed for targeted treatment, highlighting the potential of personalized medicine in dermatology.
publications.snippet: Sweet syndrome is a rare inflammatory skin condition characterized by painful, erythematous plaques and neutrophilic infiltration. In this study, we report the identification of a novel neutrophil-specific mutation in the PIK3R1 gene in a patient with recalcitrant Sweet syndrome. Whole-exome sequencing revealed a heterozygous missense mutation (c.1425A>C, p.Lys475Asn) in PIK3R1, which encodes the p85α regulatory subunit of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase (PI3K).

publications.title: Activation of TRPA1 nociceptor promotes systemic adult mammalian skin regeneration
publications.authors: Wei, J.J., Kim, H.S., Spencer, C.A., Brennan-Crispi, D., Zheng, Y., Johnson, N.M., Rosenbach, M., Miller, C., Leung, D.H., Cotsarelis, G., Leung, T.H.
publications.summary: This groundbreaking study reveals that activation of TRPA1 nociceptors can promote skin regeneration in adult mammals. The research provides insights into potential therapeutic approaches for enhancing wound healing and tissue regeneration.
publications.snippet: Tissue regeneration in adult mammals is limited, particularly in comparison to lower vertebrates. Here, we demonstrate that activation of the TRPA1 nociceptor, a pain-sensing ion channel, promotes systemic skin regeneration in adult mice. Using a combination of genetic and pharmacological approaches, we show that TRPA1 activation induces the release of neuropeptides, which in turn stimulate hair follicle stem cells and promote wound healing.

publications.title: Resolution of cutaneous sarcoidosis after Janus kinase inhibitor therapy for concomitant polycythemia vera
publications.authors: Wei J.J., Kallenbach L.R., Kreider M, Leung T.H., Rosenbach M.
publications.summary: This case report describes the unexpected resolution of cutaneous sarcoidosis in a patient treated with a Janus kinase inhibitor for polycythemia vera. The study suggests potential new therapeutic avenues for sarcoidosis treatment.
publications.snippet: We report a case of a 62-year-old woman with a long-standing history of cutaneous sarcoidosis who experienced complete resolution of her skin lesions after initiating treatment with ruxolitinib, a Janus kinase (JAK) inhibitor, for concomitant polycythemia vera. The patient had previously failed multiple treatments for sarcoidosis, including topical and systemic corticosteroids, hydroxychloroquine, and methotrexate.

publications.title: An astrocyte BMAL1-BAG3 axis protects against alpha-synuclein and tau pathology
publications.authors: Sheehan PW, Nadarajah CJ, Kanan MF, Patel TK, et al.
publications.summary: This study investigates the role of the astrocyte circadian clock gene BMAL1 and its target BAG3 in protecting against protein aggregation in neurodegenerative diseases. The research demonstrates that BMAL1 and BAG3 work together to reduce the accumulation of alpha-synuclein and tau, two proteins associated with Parkinson's and Alzheimer's diseases respectively.
publications.snippet: Our findings reveal a novel mechanism by which astrocytes, through the circadian clock gene BMAL1 and its target BAG3, contribute to neuroprotection against protein aggregation. This astrocyte-specific pathway represents a potential therapeutic target for neurodegenerative diseases characterized by alpha-synuclein and tau pathology.

publications.title: Dural lymphatics regulate clearance of extracellular tau from the CNS
publications.authors: Patel TK, Habimana-Griffin L, Gao X, et al.
publications.summary: This study explores the role of dural lymphatics in clearing extracellular tau from the central nervous system (CNS). The research demonstrates that impairment of dural lymphatic function leads to increased tau pathology in the brain, suggesting a potential new avenue for therapeutic interventions in tauopathies like Alzheimer's disease.
publications.snippet: Our results show that dural lymphatics play a crucial role in the clearance of extracellular tau from the CNS. Disruption of this clearance pathway leads to increased tau accumulation and aggregation in the brain. These findings highlight the importance of the lymphatic system in maintaining brain health and offer new insights into potential treatment strategies for tauopathies.

projects.title: Molecular mechanisms of lymphovascular dysfunction in tauopathy
projects.summary: This ongoing research project in the Jason Hinman Lab at UCLA focuses on understanding how tau protein accumulation affects the function of the brain's lymphatic system. The study aims to elucidate the molecular pathways involved in lymphovascular dysfunction in tauopathies like Alzheimer's disease.

research.title: Intestinal Perforation
research.summary: This research focuses on the causes, diagnosis, and treatment of intestinal perforation, a serious condition where a hole forms in the wall of the gastrointestinal tract. The study likely explores various factors leading to perforation, such as trauma, disease, or iatrogenic causes, and investigates optimal management strategies to improve patient outcomes.
research.snippet: Intestinal perforation represents a significant challenge in gastrointestinal medicine, often resulting in severe complications if not promptly diagnosed and treated. Our research aims to elucidate the pathophysiology of intestinal perforation, with a particular focus on identifying early biomarkers for rapid diagnosis. We have employed a combination of clinical data analysis and experimental models to better understand the molecular mechanisms underlying this condition.

research.title: Renal Replacement Therapy
research.summary: This research examines various aspects of renal replacement therapy, which is used to support or replace kidney function in patients with kidney failure. The study likely covers different modalities of renal replacement therapy, including hemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, and kidney transplantation, focusing on improving efficacy, reducing complications, and enhancing patient quality of life.
research.snippet: Renal replacement therapy remains a critical intervention for patients with end-stage renal disease. Our research investigates novel approaches to optimize dialysis techniques and explores innovative biocompatible materials for dialysis membranes. We have conducted a series of clinical trials to assess the long-term outcomes of different renal replacement modalities, with a particular emphasis on minimizing cardiovascular complications and improving overall patient survival rates.

publications.title: Air Pollution and Its Unequal Distribution
publications.summary: This article discusses the unequal distribution of air pollution in urban areas, focusing on San Francisco as a case study. It highlights the correlation between air pollution levels and low-income communities, explaining how road transportation contributes significantly to air pollution and how this disproportionately affects people of lower socioeconomic status.
publications.snippet: San Francisco is a prime example of how poor air quality overlaps with low-income communities. The image on the left illustrates air pollution in San Francisco, while the image on the right depicts average income throughout the city. The connection is clear. San Francisco neighborhoods most impacted by severe air pollution are the Western Addition, the Tenderloin, SOMA, Bayview, and Visitacion Valley. These neighborhoods all have median family incomes well below the metropolitan median (except for certain parts of SOMA).

The study emphasizes the importance of robust and generalizable models in clinical neuroimaging applications.

research.summary: Dr. Kosaraju's research focuses on leveraging artificial intelligence to accelerate the discovery of new antibiotics to combat drug-resistant superbugs. research.snippet: Researchers expose a pathogen to thousands of chemicals with diverse structures to determine which ones prevent bacterial growth. They use the results to train an AI model to predict which new chemical compounds might be similarly effective. profiles.name: Jes Fan
profiles.bio: Jes Fan is a contemporary artist known for exploring themes of identity, biology, and material transformation through sculpture and installation art.

exhibitions.title: Obscure Functions: Experiments in Decolonizing Melanin
exhibitions.description: A residency project exploring the properties and cultural significance of melanin, using genetically modified E. coli bacteria to produce the pigment. Fan created glass sculptures incorporating melanin, questioning racial identity and interspecies kinship.

projects.title: Mother is a Woman
projects.description: A custom beauty cream infused with estrogen from the artist's mother's urine. This project explored the concept of kinship outside biology and questioned whether femininity and maternalism could be transmitted through a commercial product.

research.title: Melanin Studies
research.description: Fan's research focuses on the properties and cultural implications of melanin. He collaborates with scientific labs to produce melanin using genetically modified bacteria, exploring its potential applications beyond human pigmentation.
research.summary: Jes Fan's melanin research investigates the pigment's anti-radioactive properties and its potential use in space exploration. By removing melanin from its typical biological context, Fan challenges racial constructs and explores new possibilities for interspecies connections.
research.snippet: Pinned to Fan's research board is an academic paper that touts the anti-radioactive properties of melanin, complete with a cartoon rendering of humans landing on Mars in which the bright whites of NASA spacecraft and suits are now a dark brown. In this future, science becomes disconnected from the purity and objectivity of whiteness; within the context of Fan's project, it is inextricable from the centuries-old myth that race is based in scientific fact, a potent form of racism still to be debunked for many.

research.title: 3D Object Detection and Recognition
research.description: Focused on developing novel deep learning architectures for 3D object detection and recognition in point clouds, with applications in autonomous driving and robotics.

research.title: Point Cloud Processing
research.description: Pioneered techniques for efficient and effective processing of point cloud data using deep neural networks, including the development of PointNet and PointNet++.

publications.title: PointNet: Deep Learning on Point Sets for 3D Classification and Segmentation
publications.authors: Charles R. Qi, Hao Su, Kaichun Mo, Leonidas J. Guibas
publications.summary: This paper introduces PointNet, a novel deep learning architecture for processing point cloud data directly. It addresses the challenges of unordered and irregular point sets in 3D space, providing a unified approach for various 3D recognition tasks.
publications.snippet: Our PointNet is a unified architecture that directly takes point clouds as input and outputs either class labels for the entire input or per point segment/part labels for each point of the input. The basic architecture of our network is surprisingly simple as in the initial stages each point is processed identically and independently.

publications.title: Frustum PointNets for 3D Object Detection from RGB-D Data
publications.authors: Charles R. Qi, Wei Liu, Chenxia Wu, Hao Su, Leonidas J. Guibas
publications.summary: This paper presents Frustum PointNets, a novel approach for 3D object detection that combines 2D object detection in RGB images with 3D point cloud processing. It leverages mature 2D object detection networks and extends them to 3D space efficiently.
publications.snippet: Our method, called Frustum PointNets, takes a 2D bounding box from an off-the-shelf 2D detector as input, and segments the point cloud in the frustum (extruded 2D box) to find the 3D object. It then estimates the amodal 3D bounding box for the object. We design a novel instance segmentation PointNet to efficiently segment object points in the frustum.

projects.name: Frustum PointNets
projects.description: Implementation of Frustum PointNets for 3D Object Detection from RGB-D Data.
projects.summary: This project implements the Frustum PointNets architecture for 3D object detection. It combines 2D object detection with 3D point cloud processing to achieve accurate and efficient 3D object detection. The implementation includes data preprocessing, model training, and evaluation scripts.

projects.name: VoteNet
projects.description: Deep Hough Voting for 3D Object Detection in Point Clouds
projects.summary: VoteNet is a deep learning model for 3D object detection in point clouds. It introduces a voting mechanism that generates new points that are likely to be closer to object centers. The project includes the model implementation, training pipeline, and evaluation tools for various 3D object detection benchmarks.

research.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Robot Manipulation Tasks
research.summary: This research explores the application of deep reinforcement learning techniques to improve the performance of robotic manipulation tasks. The study focuses on developing more efficient and adaptable algorithms for robots to learn complex manipulation skills in various environments.

publications.title: Incorporating Uncertainty in Data Management and Integration
publications.summary: This thesis explores novel approaches to handling uncertainty in data management systems, particularly focusing on data integration scenarios. It proposes probabilistic models and algorithms for efficiently querying and analyzing uncertain data.
publications.snippet: In modern data-driven applications, uncertainty is inherent due to various factors such as measurement errors, incomplete information, and conflicting data sources. This thesis presents a comprehensive framework for representing and reasoning about uncertainty in relational databases and data integration systems. We introduce probabilistic data models that capture complex correlations and develop efficient query processing techniques that scale to large datasets while preserving uncertainty semantics.

research.title: Greedy Shapley Client Selection for Communication-Efficient Federated Learning
research.authors: P Singhal, SR Pandey, P Popovski
research.summary: This paper proposes a novel client selection method for federated learning using Shapley values to improve communication efficiency. The approach aims to reduce the number of participating clients while maintaining model performance.
research.snippet: Federated learning (FL) is a distributed machine learning paradigm that enables training models on decentralized data. However, communication overhead remains a significant challenge in FL. This paper introduces a greedy Shapley value-based client selection algorithm to address this issue, optimizing the trade-off between model performance and communication costs.

research.title: Estimating joint probability distribution with low-rank tensor decomposition, Radon transforms and dictionaries
research.authors: P Singhal, W Mirza, A Rajwade, KS Gurumoorthy
research.summary: This research presents a novel method for estimating joint probability distributions using low-rank tensor decomposition, Radon transforms, and dictionaries. The approach aims to improve the accuracy and efficiency of probability estimation in high-dimensional spaces.
research.snippet: Estimating joint probability distributions is a fundamental problem in statistics and machine learning. This paper proposes a new technique that combines low-rank tensor decomposition with Radon transforms and dictionary learning. The method is particularly effective for high-dimensional data, offering improved computational efficiency and accuracy compared to traditional approaches.

research.title: PairNet: Training with Observed Pairs to Estimate Individual Treatment Effect
research.authors: L Nagalapatti, P Singhal, A Ghosh, S Sarawagi
research.summary: This paper introduces PairNet, a novel approach for estimating individual treatment effects using observed pairs of data. The method aims to improve causal inference in scenarios where paired observations are available.
research.snippet: Estimating individual treatment effects is crucial for personalized decision-making in various fields. PairNet leverages paired observations to enhance the accuracy of treatment effect estimates. The approach combines neural network architectures with specialized loss functions designed for paired data, potentially offering more reliable causal inferences in complex real-world scenarios.

research.title: Generating hidden object parts using a pretrained diffusion inpainting model
research.summary: This research focuses on addressing challenges in occlusion and object co-occurrence when generating hidden object parts. The study utilizes a pretrained diffusion inpainting model to tackle these complex visual recognition and synthesis problems.
research.snippet: In this paper, we propose a novel approach to generate hidden object parts using a pretrained diffusion inpainting model. Our method addresses the challenges of occlusion and object co-occurrence by leveraging the power of diffusion models in image synthesis. We demonstrate that our approach can effectively reconstruct occluded parts of objects while maintaining coherence with visible portions and surrounding context.

research.title: Analyzing neural networks trained on the Open Catalyst dataset
research.summary: This research, conducted during an internship at Meta, involves comparing predictions made by neural networks trained on the Open Catalyst dataset with chemical intuition. The study aims to enhance understanding of how these models interpret and predict chemical reactions and properties.
research.snippet: Our analysis of neural networks trained on the Open Catalyst dataset reveals interesting correlations between model predictions and established chemical intuition. We investigate the model's performance on various types of catalytic reactions and identify areas where the neural network's predictions align with or deviate from traditional chemical understanding. This work provides insights into the potential of machine learning models in accelerating catalyst discovery and design.

Our experiments show that the optimized models achieve up to 80% reduction in size and 3x speedup in inference time compared to baseline models, with minimal loss in accuracy across various computer vision tasks.

publications.title: Efficient Deep Learning on Edge Devices
publications.summary: This paper presents innovative techniques for deploying deep learning models on resource-constrained edge devices. The authors introduce a new compression algorithm that significantly reduces model size while preserving accuracy, enabling real-time inference on smartphones and IoT devices.
publications.snippet: Our proposed compression technique, EdgeCompress, utilizes a combination of weight pruning, quantization, and knowledge distillation to create highly efficient neural network models. Experimental results on various datasets demonstrate that EdgeCompress achieves up to 95% reduction in model size and 4x improvement in inference speed compared to state-of-the-art methods, while maintaining comparable accuracy within 1% of the original models.

publications.authors: Rahul Singhal, Thomas Sadowski, Manika Chaudhary, et al.
publications.summary: This paper explores the optimization of manganese dioxide-multiwall carbon nanotube composite electrodes for use in supercapacitors. The research focuses on improving the performance of these electrodes to enhance energy storage capabilities.
publications.snippet: In this study, we investigated the synthesis and characterization of manganese dioxide-multiwall carbon nanotube composite electrodes. The electrodes were prepared using various ratios of MnO2 to MWCNTs and tested for their electrochemical performance. Results showed that optimized composites exhibited improved capacitance and cycling stability compared to pure MnO2 electrodes.

publications.title: Studies of reduced graphene oxide (rGO)/ CuS nanocomposite for supercapacitor applications
publications.authors: Rahul Singhal, David Thorne, Manika Chaudhary, et al.
publications.summary: This research investigates the potential of reduced graphene oxide (rGO) and copper sulfide (CuS) nanocomposites for supercapacitor applications. The study aims to develop high-performance electrode materials for energy storage devices.
publications.snippet: We synthesized rGO/CuS nanocomposites using a simple hydrothermal method. The structural and morphological properties of the nanocomposites were characterized using various techniques. Electrochemical measurements revealed that the rGO/CuS nanocomposites exhibited superior capacitive performance compared to individual components, demonstrating their potential for supercapacitor applications.

publications.title: Equivariant Mesh Attention Networks
publications.authors: Akaash Raghunathan Parthasarathy, Ameya Joshi, Chinmay Hegde
publications.summary: This paper introduces Equivariant Mesh Attention Networks (EMANs), a novel architecture for processing 3D meshes. EMANs leverage the geometric structure of meshes and are equivariant to rotations and translations. The approach combines local attention mechanisms with global pooling operations to capture both local and global features of the mesh.
publications.snippet: We introduce Equivariant Mesh Attention Networks (EMANs), a novel architecture for processing 3D meshes that leverages their geometric structure and is equivariant to rotations and translations. Our approach combines local attention mechanisms with global pooling operations to capture both local and global features of the mesh. We demonstrate the effectiveness of EMANs on various tasks, including mesh classification, segmentation, and generation.

research.title: Application of deep learning-based topological data analysis to medical images
research.description: Dr. Singh's research focuses on developing methods to improve the interpretation of AI models for medical images, including ultrasound, computerized tomography, and magnetic resonance imaging. He is exploring the potential applications of these techniques in clinical research.
research.summary: This research investigates the use of advanced AI algorithms and topological data analysis techniques to extract meaningful information from medical images. The goal is to enhance the understanding and interpretation of AI models in the context of medical imaging, potentially leading to improved diagnostic and clinical research capabilities.
research.snippet: The application of deep learning-based topological data analysis to medical imaging presents a promising avenue for advancing patient care. By combining the power of AI algorithms with the geometric insights provided by topological analysis, researchers can uncover new imaging biomarkers and improve the interpretation of complex medical image data. This approach has the potential to revolutionize how we analyze and understand medical images across various modalities, ultimately leading to more accurate diagnoses and personalized treatment strategies.

publications.title: Research in machine learning, topological data analysis, and persistent topology
publications.description: Dr. Singh has published research in these fields, collaborating with researchers worldwide.
publications.summary: This publication likely explores the intersection of machine learning techniques with topological data analysis and persistent topology. It may present novel algorithms or methodologies that leverage geometric insights to enhance machine learning models or improve data analysis in complex datasets.
publications.snippet: In this research, we investigate the synergies between machine learning, topological data analysis, and persistent topology. By incorporating geometric and topological features into machine learning models, we demonstrate improved performance in tasks such as pattern recognition and anomaly detection. Our findings suggest that the integration of these disciplines can lead to more robust and interpretable AI systems, with potential applications across various domains including medical imaging and scientific data analysis.

research.title: ML-Leaks: Model and Data Independent Membership Inference Attacks and Defenses on Machine Learning Models
research.summary: This research focuses on membership inference attacks on machine learning models, exploring vulnerabilities and potential defense mechanisms. The study aims to understand how attackers can determine if a specific data point was used in training a model, which has significant privacy implications.
research.snippet: Membership inference attacks pose a significant threat to the privacy of individuals whose data is used to train machine learning models. This paper presents ML-Leaks, a novel approach to conducting model and data independent membership inference attacks. The authors demonstrate the effectiveness of their method across various machine learning models and datasets, highlighting the need for robust defense strategies to protect against such privacy breaches.

research.title: Evaluating Membership Inference Vulnerabilities in Variational Autoencoders with Differential Privacy
research.summary: This study examines the vulnerability of variational autoencoders (VAEs) to membership inference attacks and explores the use of differential privacy as a defense mechanism. The research aims to quantify the privacy risks associated with VAEs and evaluate the effectiveness of differential privacy in mitigating these risks.
research.snippet: Variational autoencoders have gained popularity in various applications due to their ability to learn compact representations of complex data. However, their susceptibility to membership inference attacks raises concerns about data privacy. This paper investigates the extent of these vulnerabilities and proposes the application of differential privacy techniques to enhance the privacy guarantees of VAEs. The authors present empirical results demonstrating the trade-offs between model utility and privacy protection.

publications.title: Observation of quantum-Hall effect in 3D topological materials
publications.summary: This paper reports the observation of the quantum Hall effect in three-dimensional topological materials, a phenomenon previously thought to be limited to two-dimensional systems. The research team, including Jehyun Kim, used advanced experimental techniques to detect and characterize this effect in bulk samples of topological insulators.
publications.snippet: The quantum Hall effect, a hallmark of two-dimensional electron systems, has been a cornerstone in our understanding of topological phases of matter. Here, we report the unexpected observation of quantum Hall states in three-dimensional topological insulators. Our measurements reveal quantized Hall conductance plateaus accompanied by vanishing longitudinal resistance, providing unambiguous evidence for the quantum Hall effect in these materials.

research.title: Machine learning for detection of cyberattacks on industrial control systems
research.summary: This research focuses on implementing machine learning as an early detection tool for anomalies, particularly cyberattacks, in industrial control systems. The study aims to help researchers and industry leaders understand how to effectively use ML tools for cybersecurity in rapidly digitalizing traditional industries.
research.snippet: Senior executives for industrial systems are increasingly facing the need to reassess their cyber risk as cyberattacks are on a steep rise. This is because of the rapid digitalization of traditional industries, designed to work for decades at a time when security was not a priority. Simultaneously, the available tools to detect these attacks have also increased. This thesis aims to help researchers and industry leaders understand how to implement machine learning (ML) as an early detection tool for anomalies (cyberattacks being a subset of anomalies) in their processes.

research.title: Optimizing Neural Networks for Edge Computing Devices
research.summary: This research focused on developing techniques to optimize neural networks for deployment on resource-constrained edge computing devices. The study explored various compression and quantization methods to reduce model size and computational requirements while maintaining accuracy.
research.snippet: Our findings demonstrate that a combination of pruning and quantization techniques can reduce model size by up to 80% with less than 2% loss in accuracy. We propose a novel adaptive quantization method that dynamically adjusts bit-width based on layer importance, resulting in superior performance compared to static quantization approaches.

publications.title: Efficient Neural Network Deployment on Edge Devices: A Comparative Study
publications.summary: This paper presents a comprehensive comparison of various techniques for deploying neural networks on edge devices. It analyzes the trade-offs between model size, inference speed, and accuracy across different optimization methods.
publications.snippet: Our experiments reveal that hybrid approaches combining model pruning, quantization, and knowledge distillation yield the best results across a range of edge devices. We introduce a novel metric, the Edge Efficiency Score (EES), which provides a holistic measure of a model's suitability for edge deployment by considering size, speed, and accuracy simultaneously.

publications.title: Found by Love
publications.description: Details his conversion narrative and journey with Christ
publications.summary: Found by Love is primarily about hope and life restored at the deepest level. It unpacks the question of identity and becoming a priest in Hinduism, which involves a complete forgetting of one's identity. The book explores the author's journey from Hinduism to Christianity, emphasizing the concept of a relationship with God rather than religion, and grace instead of earning God's love.
publications.snippet: After I began to write, I realised how my story would speak to people from all backgrounds, faiths, and cultures. Found by Love is primarily about hope — about life restored at the deepest level. I unpack the question of identity and becoming a priest, which in Hinduism is a complete forgetting of your identity. When you leave the faith, someone gets your ordained name immediately, and your speeches and work are deleted from the system. It's about a relationship with God, not a religion; grace, not having to earn God's love.

speaking_engagements: Offers insights on bridging Eastern and Western spiritual perspectives
Shares personal journey from Hinduism to Christianity

projects.name: Distributed Key-Value Store
projects.description: Implemented a scalable and fault-tolerant distributed key-value store using Raft consensus algorithm.
projects.summary: This project involved building a distributed key-value store that ensures consistency and fault tolerance across multiple nodes. The implementation used the Raft consensus algorithm to maintain a replicated log and handle leader election. The system was designed to scale horizontally and recover from node failures.

projects.name: Secure File Sharing System
projects.description: Developed a secure file sharing system with end-to-end encryption and access control.
projects.summary: This project focused on creating a secure file sharing platform that prioritizes user privacy and data protection. The system implements end-to-end encryption to ensure that files remain confidential during transmission and storage. Access control mechanisms were put in place to manage user permissions and file sharing capabilities.

research.title: Enhancing Privacy in Federated Learning Systems
research.summary: This research explored methods to improve privacy guarantees in federated learning environments without compromising model accuracy. The study proposed a novel approach combining differential privacy and secure multi-party computation.
research.snippet: Federated learning has emerged as a promising paradigm for collaborative machine learning while preserving data privacy. However, existing federated learning systems still face challenges in providing strong privacy guarantees without significantly impacting model performance. In this paper, we present a novel framework that integrates differential privacy and secure multi-party computation to enhance privacy protection in federated learning environments.

research.title: Safety and efficacy of protamine in the reversal of heparin in transcatheter aortic valve replacement
research.summary: This study investigates the use of protamine to reverse heparin anticoagulation in transcatheter aortic valve replacement (TAVR) procedures. The research aims to assess the safety and effectiveness of protamine administration in TAVR patients, potentially improving post-procedural outcomes and reducing bleeding complications.
research.snippet: Transcatheter aortic valve replacement (TAVR) has emerged as a minimally invasive alternative to surgical aortic valve replacement for patients with severe aortic stenosis. Heparin is routinely used during TAVR to prevent thrombotic complications. However, the reversal of heparin anticoagulation with protamine at the end of the procedure remains controversial. This study evaluates the safety and efficacy of protamine administration in TAVR patients, analyzing outcomes such as bleeding events, vascular complications, and overall procedural success.

publications.title: Safety and efficacy of protamine in the reversal of heparin in transcatheter aortic valve replacement
